channel.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Walmart alters diversity policies, moves away from 'woke' initiatives after Robby Starbuck talks
item.description: Walmart revised its diversity and inclusion policies, discontinuing its Racial Equity Centre and withdrawing from the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index. Following discussions with activist Robby Starbuck, the company will also remove certain products and reassess Pride event funding, aiming to prevent children's exposure to inappropriate content.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Replace Jew with Brahmin’: How participants became ‘anti-Hindu’ after DEI training
item.description: The Hindu American Foundation (HAF) has accused The New York Times and Bloomberg of suppressing a study by the Network Contagion Research Institute (NCRI) that reveals harmful impacts of caste-based DEI training on Hindu-Americans. The study found that Equality Labs’ anti-caste materials heightened perceptions of bias, fostered dehumanizing rhetoric against Brahmins, and fueled distrust. Critics argue such trainings exacerbate divisions instead of reducing discrimination. HAF condemned the media for withholding the findings, calling for transparency and accountability. The controversy highlights broader issues with DEI programs and the risks of fostering polarization instead of promoting inclusivity.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prosecutors seek 20-year sentence for main accused Dominique Pelicot in France mass rape case
item.description: French prosecutors sought a 20-year sentence for Dominique Pelicot, accused of drugging and facilitating the rape of his wife by dozens of men. The trial, involving 50 defendants, concluded arguments amidst national protests against gender-based violence. Pelicot confessed to the crimes, while many defendants claimed they believed the acts were consensual.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Putin signs law forgiving debt arrears for new Russian recruits for Ukraine war
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a law forgiving up to $95,835 in debt for new army recruits who sign at least one-year contracts to fight in Ukraine. This measure, effective from December 1st, aims to boost military recruitment without resorting to another general mobilization, as Russia grapples with increasing consumer debt among its citizens amidst the ongoing conflict.

item.title: Red Sea disaster: 16 missing after yacht sank in Egypt
item.description: A tourist yacht, Sea Story, sank in the Red Sea near Marsa Alam, Egypt, after being hit by a large wave. 28 of the 44 passengers were rescued, but 16 remain missing. The yacht had departed despite weather warnings, and rescue operations are ongoing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: King Charles and Queen Camilla set to embark on journey to India: Report
item.description: King Charles III, while continuing his cancer recovery, is planning a major tour of South Asia in 2024, including India, Pakistan, and Bangladesh. This follows a successful trip to Australia and Samoa and signifies a return to extensive international travel for the monarch. The tour holds significant political and cultural importance for Britain.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Yeah, whatever lmao': Elon Musk, netizens react to Jim VandeHei's speech on citizen journalism
item.description: Axios CEO Jim VandeHei criticized Elon Musk's claim that "citizen journalists" are replacing traditional media. VandeHei defended professional journalism's importance, comparing it to neurosurgery. Musk responded dismissively on X, sparking online debate about the future of media.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Judge Dredd is coming to town’: Elon Musk responds to Tom Homan’s deportation dispute with Denver mayor
item.description: Incoming border security chief Tom Homan clashed with Denver Mayor Michael Johnston over the city potentially obstructing federal deportations. Homan threatened legal action against Johnston, while Elon Musk compared Homan's stance to "Judge Dredd." The debate highlights the tension between local and federal immigration enforcement under the incoming Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Opposition lawmakers clash with Serbian government during Parliament session
item.description: A brawl erupted in Serbia's parliament after opposition lawmakers accused the ruling party of responsibility for a deadly train station roof collapse. Opposition members displayed accusatory banners and chanted "killers," leading to physical altercations with the ruling coalition. The opposition demands accountability for the tragedy, including the prime minister's resignation, amidst accusations of corruption and delayed action.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hong Kong court grants housing and inheritance rights to same-sex couples
item.description: Hong Kong's highest court has delivered a landmark victory for LGBTQ+ rights, affirming same-sex couples' housing and inheritance rights. The court ruled against government appeals, deeming the exclusion of same-sex couples from public housing and inheritance laws discriminatory.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Bullet with bullet': Imran Khan supporters break lockdown in Islamabad
item.description: Thousands of supporters of jailed former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan clashed with police in Islamabad, defying a government ban and demanding his release. Security forces responded with tear gas and rubber bullets, resulting in casualties and injuries. The US urged restraint and respect for human rights. Over 4,000 Khan supporters were arrested, and internet services were disrupted.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Price of fentanyl will rise sharply': Elon Musk on Trump’s tariff crackdown
item.description: President-elect Trump announced plans to impose tariffs on goods from China, Mexico, and Canada to combat illegal immigration and drug trafficking. He proposes a 25% tariff on Mexican and Canadian imports and an additional 10% on Chinese goods. Trump cited the influx of drugs and crime and accused China of failing to curb fentanyl production.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'You better start packing now': Trump’s border czar Tom Homan unveils tough deportation plan
item.description: Tom Homan, Trump's appointed border czar, is preparing a comprehensive deportation plan prioritizing the removal of illegal immigrants, many of whom he says should have been deported under previous administrations. Homan's plan contrasts sharply with the Biden administration's approach, which has seen record illegal border crossings.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why hundreds of Pakistanis are ready to 'do or die' for jailed ex-PM Imran Khan?
item.description: Supporters of jailed ex-PM Imran Khan march on Islamabad, protesting against the Shehbaz Sharif government and demanding Khan's release. The government vows to suppress the protests, while the US urges restraint from both sides. Controversy surrounds Khan's wife, Bushra Bibi, over statements allegedly critical of Saudi Arabia, which Khan denies.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pilot and rescue dog killed in remote woods in New York; two dogs survive
item.description: A pilot and a rescue dog perished in a small plane crash in the snowy Catskill Mountains while transporting three dogs from Maryland to Albany. Two other dogs survived the crash. Pilot Seuk Kim, a volunteer known for his dedication to animal rescue, encountered poor visibility and turbulence before the crash.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bitcoin millionaire hides $2m treasure across US in five chests filled with gold, gems and rare cards
item.description: A Bitcoin investor, Jon Collins-Black, has concealed five treasure chests worth over $2 million across the US. His book, "There's Treasure Inside," provides clues to their locations. The chests contain diverse items, from ancient coins to a Bitcoin, and are hidden in safe, accessible public places. Collins-Black hopes to inspire adventure and curiosity with this real-life treasure hunt.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘I never intended to kill anyone’: Florida woman sentenced to 25 years for shooting black neighbour dead
item.description: A Florida woman was sentenced to 25 years for killing her neighbour. The two women argued over children playing near the woman's home. The woman shot her neighbour through the door. She claimed self-defence but was found guilty of manslaughter. The victim's family mourned their loss. The judge called the shooting unnecessary. The woman expressed regret in court.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Japan rocket site gutted in fire, test halted
item.description: An engine combustion test for Japan's Epsilon S rocket was suspended after a fire erupted at the Tanegashima Space Center. The incident is under investigation. The Epsilon S, a next-generation small rocket, was scheduled for its debut flight by March but has faced previous delays, including an engine test failure 16 months ago.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Will just get pilots killed': Elon Musk suggests fighter jets be replaced by drones
item.description: Elon Musk criticized manned fighter jets, especially the F-35, as obsolete, advocating for drones. He called the F-35 expensive and flawed, while a researcher defended its strategic importance, highlighting its advanced technology and impact on geopolitical rivals.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mike Waltz to resign for national security role as Trump pushes Florida lawmakers to run for Congress
item.description: Florida Representative Mike Waltz will resign from Congress on January 20 to become Trump's national security adviser. Special elections will be held to fill his and other vacant seats, narrowing the House Republican majority. Trump has endorsed candidates for the upcoming races, including Randy Fine for the 6th District.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
